result.execSummary:
The defendant Jervis R Akins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jervis R Akins in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 months jail (straight time);

TERM OF PROBATION: 12 months

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with the co-actor or victim
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Restitution to be determined. 
 

  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
